data.title: THE MIDNIGHT GHOST TRAIN Issue 'The Watchers Nest' Lyric Video; Playing DESCENDANTS OF CROM Fest In Sept. ⋆ Riff Relevant
data.meta_description: THE MIDNIGHT GHOST TRAIN Issue 'The Watchers Nest' Lyric Video; Playing DESCENDANTS OF CROM Fest In Sept. ⋆ Riff Relevant
data.text:
(By Pat ‘Riot’ Whitaker, Senior Writer/Editor, RiffRelevant.com)

Heavy rock band The Midnight Ghost Train have just shared a new lyric video for their track “The Watchers Nest“. The cut hails from the band’s upcoming Napalm Records album release ‘Cypress Ave.’, due out on July 28th.

The Midnight Ghost Train‘s style of bluesy, organic rock and roll is an infectious sonic elixir, indeed. Straightforward and forcefully powerful, the new album is sure to be a smash with fans of underground music. Check out the clip below, along with the previously released “Red Eyed Junkie Queen“.

The Midnight Ghost Train is one of many great bands set to play the inaugural edition of the upcoming Descendants Of Crom Festival in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

They, along with an unbelievable roster of acts that includes Earthride, Solace, Foghound, Brimstone Coven, EYE, Valkyrie, Archarus, Wasted Theory and more, will descend on Steel City this September 30th for one day of life-changing music. Get more info and details at Descendants Of Crom or the Facebook Event at this location.

Cypress Ave. track listing:

“Tonight”

“Red Eyed Junkie Queen”

“Glenn’s Promise”

“Bury Me Deep”

“The Watchers Nest”

“Break My Love”

“Lemon Trees”

“The Boogie Down” (feat. Sonny Cheeba)

“Black Wave”

“The Echo”

“I Can’t Let You Go” (Bonus Track)
